whereWhenWhat.label: Where
whereWhenWhat.title: Voksenåsen Hotel in Oslo
whereWhenWhat.text: The Arctic IoT Challenge is of course held among trees with an amazing view.

whereWhenWhat.label: When
whereWhenWhat.title: 12-15 of March 2020
whereWhenWhat.text: It all starts with you rigging your camp on Thursday 12th of March! Sign up now to secure your slot! There's still some spots left.

whereWhenWhat.label: What
whereWhenWhat.title: Program 2020
whereWhenWhat.text: A three-day hackaton challenge focusing on the Internet of Things (IoT)

whyAbout.label: Why
whyAbout.title: Empower your brain... and
whyAbout.text: A three-day hackaton challenge focusing on the Internet of Things (IoT)

list.title: ...share knowledge and learn
list.text: For three days, your team stay in a hotel in the woods at the outskirts of Oslo (there might be wolves). There, you will not only compete with other teams, but also get to know them, learn from them and be inspired.

list.title: ...talk to IoT experts
list.text: You get to speak with the judges/speakers a lot more than you would in a normal conference. They will stay at the hotel for the whole event, and circulate among the teams to guide them and answer questions.

list.title: ...all them cool gadgets!
list.text: We love gadgets! And we really hope you do the same, you will get to play with some cool gadgets.

list.title: ...pride and glory
list.text: You get to show off your skills in the biggest and most prestigious IoT hackaton in Norway.

list.title: ...Best. Party. Ever. Really!
list.text: There will be a party too! The final night, we'll have a grand party (bring some nice clothes). This is where the winner is elected. Maybe your team makes it to the final, and gets the winning votes?
Tasty breakfast, awesome lunch and fancy dinner. In short: food all day.
Comfy hotel room at Voksenåsen from Thursday Sunday

list2.text: New nerdy friends and great laughs
Get awesome talks about the amazing IoT universe. Check out our speakers!

list.title: ...bring your own ideas
list.text: You have to have some sort of idea on what you want to make as a project when you arrive to the challenge. There are no rules on what you should make,

list.title: ...bring all your equipment
list.text: Your team needs to bring all your computers, keyboards, soldering iron, screens or others stuff you might need during your project. There will be enough electrical outlets for each station and a decent WiFi when you arrive

bottomBoxesAbout.label: Our mission
bottomBoxesAbout.title: #ariot20
bottomBoxesAbout.text: aims to stimulate collaborative learning, networking and stimulation of ideas for participants through hands-on, time-limited challenges. We are competitive, yet helpful and sharing (also across teams), realizing that collective learning is more important than personal gain.

bottomBoxesAbout.label: Our code of conduct
bottomBoxesAbout.title: Everyone is welcome
bottomBoxesAbout.text: Even though we don't expect this to be an issue, we're just making sure that you know: ARIoT is dedicated to providing a harassment-free conference experience for everyone, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of conference participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate for any conference venue, including talks. Conference participants violating these rules may be sanctioned or expelled from the conference without a refund at the discretion of the conference organizers.
